Package io.github.ethankelly

Class Agent

java.lang.Object
io.github.ethankelly.Agent
public class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
Agency is the basis and purpose of the model we are developing. Each agent has certain attributes that need to be determined initially and updated at each time-step in the model, which are:
  • The vertex the agent is located at
  • The peril rating, based on the agent's proximity to infected vertices
  • The protection rating, which is partially random but increases with peril
  • The state of the vertex - whether it is susceptible to infection, infected, recovered or defended.

Each agent's attributes are based on the initial state of the graph. In the model, we choose at random an initial vertex to be the 'setOutbreak' or source node. At time 0, only the source node is infected and all others are susceptible or protected, if there is no path between them and the source node for instance. An agent can transition to the protected state by having a protection rating of 1, which happens in different ways depending on context, such as via influence exerted or because the peril rating is also high and the baseline random protection was fairly high to begin with. At each time-step, we need to determine any changes to state, protection and peril.

  • Constructor Details

    • Agent

      public Agent​(int vertex, double peril, double protection, State state)
      Class constructor.
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex position (location) of the agent.
      peril - the initial peril rating of the agent (based on proximity to fire).
      protection - the initial protection rating of the agent (partially random, increases with peril).
      state - the initial state of the agent.

  • Method Details

    • getVertex

      public int getVertex()
      The vertex attribute of an agent indicates their location on the graph that the model uses. This, in turn, helps determine which other agents (vertices) they are connected to, which may indicate a possible route of infection.
      Returns:
      the vertex location of the agent.

    • getPeril

      public double getPeril()
      An agent's peril rating represents the danger they are currently in. The more infected vertices within a certain proximity, and the closer infected vertices are to the given agent, the higher the peril rating. Peril is zero if there is no path between the vertex and an infected agent, in which case they are placed into the protected state. Peril is one if the agent is in immediate danger, i.e. one of their directly adjacent neighbours is infected.
      Returns:
      the current peril rating of the agent.

    • setPeril

      public void setPeril​(double peril)
      We assign the peril rating of the agent based on the current graph state (as determined in the main model class) - specifically, the agent's proximity to infected vertices.
      Parameters:
      peril - the peril rating to be set to the current vertex.

    • getProtection

      public double getProtection()
      The protection rating of an agent is based on a baseline random real number, between 0 and 1, and the peril. As peril increases, protection increases - simulating an agent becoming more concerned as more agents close to them contract the infection, thereby adopting more protective behaviours and increasing their overall protection rating. The protection rating is also updated when we deploy a defensive move in the model, and the higher the defence rating the smaller the likelihood of the agent contracting the contagion.
      Returns:
      the protection rating of the current agent.

    • setProtection

      public void setProtection​(double protection)
      Several methods update the method, whenever the peril has been updated (i.e. the state of the graph has changed in some way, peril may have changed and so protection also needs to be updated and set to its new value). We do not allow a protection of rating over 1, so this method prevents the value being set from being greater than that.
      Parameters:
      protection - the new protection to be assigned to the current agent.

    • getState

      public State getState()
      Each agent can be in one of a number of states, namely any of those in the State enum. These indicate which compartment of the SIR model the agent belongs to and each has an associated value to make computation simpler when updating the graph state and so on.
      Returns:
      the state to which the current agent belongs.

    • setState

      public void setState​(State state)
      For methods that update the state of the graph, they may have to update the state or states of certain agents. For instance, if an agent has been defended so that their protection rating is now 1.0, they are moved to the protected state.
      Parameters:
      state - the state into which we want to move the current agent.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a textual representation of the agent, detailing its vertex location, peril rating, protection rating and current state. This is used to print to the console.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the agent.
